result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher P. Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher P. Smith in court with attorney Zachary Paul Glascock.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CM13, 16CM80, and 17CM94 @ 10:50 a.m. 17CM94 - Atty Glascock appears specially, has received copy of complaint, reading waived.  Agreement stated - 17CM94 - Def will plead to cts 1 & 2, ct 3 dri. 16CM80 - dri, 16CM13 - dri. Def given consideration for AODA and follow through already done. 17CM94 cts 1 & 2 -  Withheld sentence, 12 months probation on each, concurrent, costs, DNA surcharge and sample, no restitution has been requested. AODA if DOC requires, continue treatment as recommended, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, counseling as deemed necessary. Atty Glascock and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. 17CM94 ct 1 - no contest plea. Ct 2 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 3, and 16CM13 ct 1 and 16CM80 cts 1 & 2. Constitutional  rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Glascock satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made.  Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 17CM94 cts 1 & 2, misd theft and misd bail jumping. Sentencing remarks by counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. Ct 1 - sentence withheld, 12 months probation - court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, AODA if required by agent, treatment or counseling as required, no use or possession of controlled substances illegally. Ct 2 - 12 months probation, concurrent, court costs, DNA surcharge waived, other conditions the same as ct 1. Discussion regarding credit if revoked. Atty Glascock believes credit for time served on dri cases should apply. Court grants credit for 1 day if revoked and reserves right to be heard on issue if revoked.  Court has received letter by fax from bond poster. Bond from 17CM94 - apply to costs and DNA surcharge first, then apply $182.63 to 16FO144, return balance to poster. 16CM13 Court will not forfeit bond, return to poster. 16CM80 return bond to poster. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Atty Glascock gives citation re sentence credit on read in charges. Nothing from State. Court will grant 12 days credit if revoked. Def advised to check with jail regarding booking on 17CM94. Court vacates warrant on 16FO144.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher P. Smith in court with attorney Zachary Paul Glascock.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @9:58 a.m.  Court calls 16-CM-13 and 16-CM-80.  16-CM-13 set for motion hearing.  16-CM-80/Jury trial date set for 7-12-17/9:00 a.m.  FPT 6-30-17/1:30 p.m.  Bond forfeiture adjourned to 6-30-17/1:30 p.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 30, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Zachary Paul Glascock in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CM13 & 16CM80  @ 11:04 am.  Atty Glascock gives explanation where def. is.  State has come up with offer. State would like proof of rehab, if not in rehab that Bond Forfeiture to continue.  Court will reserve ruling on bond forfeiture at time of sentencing, no notices need to be sent.  Atty Glascock would like motion to be held. Court will withdraw motion, Atty Glascock to re file.  Mr. Smith needs documentation  for rehab, needs to be ready for sentencing if not Court may increase bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2017 at 09:00 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 24, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher P. Smith in court with attorney Zachary Paul Glascock.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 13CM13 & 16CM80 @ 2:22pm.  Atty Glascock has copy of complaints, waives reading & enters Not Guilty plea to both cases. Court will receive Not Guilty plea. Court will reserve bail bond forfeiture on later date.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Zachary Paul Glascock in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the court record.  Court will not rule on bond forfeiture def has counsel.  Statement by counsel.  16CM80 will also be adjouned until 6-27-16 @ 1:30 pm  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher P. Smith in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond has been set and posted.  Def has contacted the public defender, def is eligible for public defender.  Court will take 5-23-16 date off and 6-8-16 date off and will call  cases together   Def wishes to lift the no contact.  Court will have law enforcement to go with def to residence.  If individual wants  no contact lifted, he should contact DA.  Court will reduce bond.  Balance of bond to def.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
